intro: Decaloba rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed decaloba, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its broad, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
